intro: Brandesia serpyllifolia, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. The plant has small, alternate leaves that are usually less than 1 cm in length, and it produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and is known for its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions. Brandesia serpyllifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
